The topic of this article may not meet Wikipedia's general notability guideline. Please help to establish notability by citing reliable secondary sources that are independent of the topic and provide significant coverage of it beyond a mere trivial mention. If notability cannot be established, the article is likely to be merged, redirected, or deleted.
Find sources: "Chicago Fusion Theatre" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR (June 2017) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

Chicago Fusion Theatre (CFT) was founded in Chicago, Illinois in 2007 by a collective of artists and business associates committed to physical based theatre that fuses different genres, mediums and styles in an effort to foster a greater appreciation of diversity and the arts in the community.[1] The company has put on several productions since its conception including Hugging the Shoulder and bobrauschenbergamerica.[2] CFT's next production will be J.B. by Archibald MacLeish and opens on March 12th.

References[edit]

  1. ^ Chicago Fusion Theatre [1]
  2. ^ bobrauschenbergamerica review [2]
